meanings.definition: To formulate a new theory or set of theories.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours retheorizing her research findings to develop a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often engage in retheorizing to explore different explanations for phenomena.
meanings.sent3: John couldn't sleep, so he started retheorizing about the origins of the universe to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a workshop, constantly retheorizing the mysteries of the human mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creative process involved retheorizing traditional painting techniques.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or revise existing theories.
meanings.sent1: After receiving feedback, she decided to retheorize her approach to the project.
meanings.sent2: Historians often find value in retheorizing past events to gain new insights.
meanings.sent3: The detective kept retheorizing the crime scene, trying to uncover new clues.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, she was constantly retheorizing the dynamics of human relationships.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged students to engage in retheorizing their understanding of complex topics.
